post.body: Correction: the Residents are like a samplicious, musique concrete, nineteen-seventies, Devoesque, Dada, uncool Animal Collective.
Yeah, I don't really feel the need to listen to this whole Residents album. There guys are like a musique concrete Animal Collective.
Fuck. Dudes, Stuart Effing Kinley should hear this damn album. BTW, Andrew: that Farrakhan record is framed and hanging in my room.
Listening to the Residents' "Third Reich 'n' Roll." It's a weird ride. I read that they were the first group ever to sample James Brown.
Anybody remember Mike Jones? "Still Tippin" was pure fire. Go YouTube it.
Listening to Mingus and trying to fall asleep. Merry Xmas, folks. I should probably switch to something mellower.
Reading Dawkins, loafing around. The air says early to bed. Feeling more than a wee bit depressed.
Tinnitus. At least I believe It's spelled that way.
John Legend just sang me an elaborate analogy between nutmeg and nookie. Colbert Xmas special is the best Xmas special of all time.
Listening to Farrakhan on vinyl. Thanks, Andrew.
I just watched two alpacas having sex on YouTube. Don't worry. I wasn't aroused. Tumblr's a muhfucka.
Christmas means mixed nuts (double entendre: family's visiting). I like Brazil nuts the best. (Which I mean literally: no Brazilians in ...
Reading Dawkins. Done with exams.
Took me four tries. But I finally got that motherfucker right.
American flag sticker on a Suburban's gas tank. Poetry.
Andrew after kissing Stuart's neck (at my jesting request): "Oh yeah. I'm a homophile."
Great for the world's piano teachers, though. They could use the extra cash. Coldplay. On that note, when's Bono gonna get off his ass?
It's just lame that they're the Jethro Tull of piano to some people. I mean, the instrument existed before Coldplay went all U2 on its ass.
I take it back. I actually think It's cool that Coldplay like Kate Bush. I mean, who can say no to "Speed me Sound"?
Green tea is my favorite kind of tea. It's official. To quote Stuart: "That's very... Canadian of you."
